summary: Starting Killing Eve. Thank goodness for Hulu. First time in four weeks I can watch a TV show and actually pay attention to it...
body: Starting Killing Eve. Thank goodness for Hulu. First time in four weeks I can watch a TV show and actually pay attention to it without having work or other crap interfering. I am hoping this is as good as everyone says it is. I have high expectations.

summary: Finally watched Killing Eve, and I don’t really understand why everyone is going on and on about it.* The acting is really good,...
body:
Finally watched Killing Eve, and I don’t really understand why everyone is going on and on about it.* The acting is really good, but the writing is… really lacking. I haven’t read the original novels, nor do I intend to, as spy thrillers are really not my thing, so I don’t know how much the general sloppiness is due to adaptation constrictions, but it bothers me that a lot of things happen mostly because a) everybody starts acting like an idiot (Bill’s death comes to mind) and b) the story needs to move from A to B, and it doesn’t really matter how (Bill’s death, again). It’s kinda like Luther, only with less pronounced wish fulfilment (this aspect made me quit Luther after a couple of episodes, as I really haven’t got the patience for a writer’s stiffy over what they think is The Coolest Thing Ever tm). So, I’ve seen it, and it’s mostly enjoyable, but it’s amateurishly plotted and extremely predictable, so I don’t think I’ll be tuning in for the second series. 

* The fact that the leads are all women and that the protagonist is an Asian woman is fine and dandy, but diversity is absolutely not enough to create a good show (case in point: How to Get Away with Murder, with its idiotic plots and mostly wooden performances, apart from Davis’ - and Davis on her own could not carry that entire mess of a show).

tags: also known as meta-ing two shows
ah the sherlock meta days did leave their mark
summary: I finally finished watching Killing Eve. Incoming rant/meta/spam. So I wanna rectify, I know it’s easy to compare KE to...
body:
I finally finished watching Killing Eve. Incoming rant/meta/spam.

So I wanna rectify, I know it’s easy to compare KE to Hannibal, and it’s the best way to fast explain the show, but I hope it doesnt sound like it’s a one to one comparison, or that one is a mirror view of the other.

Will was manipulated, and forced to get close to the bad side basically. He has just like Eve, very strong morals, both start firmly planted in the good side of the fight. And it takes a lot for Will to consider and even more to accept that he could fit just as fine in the other side. But Eve, and in this case her circumstances, change fast, she is not sure she works for the good guys, or at least not sure they are as good as they seem individually. 

And what’s even more interesting is that Eve was bored with her life, she wanted the excitement, the chase. By the time we meet him, Will has accepted his fate, in that people will always treat him differently, and found it best to be a recluse and just wants to be left alone. On the other hand, for Villanelle killing is her job, while for Hannibal it’s a thing he does on his own terms. 

Another aspect, maybe a bit weird but eh, is the age difference. Will gets the attention of an older man, that just happens to have a few illegal hobbies, which he has perfected for many years. He is so good at it that he always went under the radar and was never caught. But Eve, a woman settled with a job and husband and all falls for a younger woman, who was trained, who is used and controlled by a secret organization, but that is and acts like any other young woman of her age.

I like the path that Eve takes, it starts with practicing the puncture wound on herself, breaking that window, trying on the clothes and perfume, and of course her usual verbal outbursts of sincerity. But what ends up surprising the viewer is her moments when she suddenly takes action, goes behind her boss, ignore orders, go to paris, drink champagne, trash an apartment, etc. Most of them she tries to justify as a means to do her job or for revenge, but eventually she stops hiding behind these reasons and stating she just wants to find Villanelle.

Im not even going to get into the sincerity aspect. Like both Eve and Villanelle are so blunt and honest with each other while on the other side Will and Hannibal talk in metaphors and obscure refs and can only be honest with each other if there is fresh blood at their feet. But, you can’t help and wonder why is that, and I somehow don’t think it’s the case necesarily that it’s easier to allow two women to be honest about their feelings for each other on tv than it would be for two men.

These are different shows, Hannibal obviously more focused on aesthetics and art, and Killing Eve more down to earth, they aired in somehow different times, between them a change in culture, in the attitude about portraying diversity. But while Hannibal was indeed making an effort in that, hannigram wasn’t planned, it just happened, and yes kudos for the writers for not ignoring it. On the other side villaneve is too entwined to the main plot for it to not have been planned and so easier to write in those moments. 

Plus one has 3 seasons, the second is waiting to start it’s 2nd season now. With neither story complete it will be so interesting to see what happens next and how they eventually end.

Plus plus fuck it, hannibal is filmed in a fucking cave with no light, while in killing eve you can actually see shit so yeah there are some things that can be compared.

by SinkOrFly

summary:
I love the killing eve finale because it has loads of great humour so far my fav bit is
Guy: villanelle is trying to kill me. We...
body:
I love the killing eve finale because it has loads of great humour so far my fav bit is

Guy: villanelle is trying to kill me. We need to give her what she wants to stop her

Eve: me

Guy: ?? No, me! She is trying to kill ME!

Eve: oh right whatever *continues thristing after villanelle in silence*

summary:
[Eve and Villanelle both reach for a croissant causing their hands to touch]
Eve: Villanelle?
Villanelle, blushing: Yeah?
Eve:...
body:
[Eve and Villanelle both reach for a croissant causing their hands to touch]

Eve: Villanelle?


Villanelle, blushing: Yeah?


Eve: Get the fuck off my croissant
